text: O Yağız iti duyduğu haberi Ural’a yetiştirmekle vazifelidir.
english: The Oil Dog is responsible for bringing the news to the Urals.

text: Madem öyledir, o vakit ona kendi yükümüzü yükleyelim.
english: Then let us burden him with our burden.

text: Bir oyun kuralım ki kurduğumuz oyunu Ural’a yetiştirsin.
english: Let's play a game that will bring our game to the Ural.

text: Ural da, kalesine sığındığı Vasilius da gözünü dört açacaktır, Ertuğrul Bey.
english: The Ural and Vasilius, whose castle he has taken refuge in, will be in the open, Lord Ertuğrul.
We took their ammunition and drowned their furnaces.
Vasilius, the ammunition we have captured...
...calculated that we would distribute them to the Turkmen villages.

text: Biz de ona bu haberi uçurduk mu…
…Vasilius hem mühimmatlarını geri almak isteyecek hem de intikamını.
english: ...Vasilius will want to take back both his ammunition and his revenge.

text: Ertuğrul'un el koyduğu mühimmatların akıbetini öğrendim.
english: I've learned the fate of the munitions that Ertuğrul has seized.

text: Kendilerine itibar eden Türkmen beylerine dağıtacakmış.
english: He's going to give it to the Turkmen gentlemen who respect him.
They're preparing to attack the pen.
...and Ertuğrul will be at the head of the coast.

text: Ural'la buluşmaya mı giderler dersin beyim?
english: You think they're going to meet the Ural, sir?
These gentlemen are the same, Daggan.
There's no hunting without us, Blessed.

text: Belki bizim nasibimize de üç, beş tane hain düşer.
english: Maybe we'll have three or five traitors.
Tell me about my loyal Alps...
I'll take care of this myself.
Vasilius has two women after me.
But I had to come here.
They're following the store, we know.
The life of Mr. Ertuğrul is in danger.
The caravan with Mr. Ertuğrul on it...
...they'll raid the place they call the Foxtail.

text: Ertuğrul Bey'im Bamsı'yı öldürmeye kalkan o soysuzu yakalamak için oyun eder.
english: My lord Ertuğrul is playing to catch the line who tried to kill Bamsı.

text: Zalimin yanında olmaktansa mazlumun yanında olmayı yeğleriz.
english: We would rather be with the wrongdoer than with the wrongdoer.

text: O vakit sultanımızın tesis etmeye çalıştığı barışı korumak için...
english: To maintain the peace that our sultan was trying to establish...
...we will work together, we will fight.
While Ertuğrul is threatening the country by fighting...
...so that we do not get in the way of our sultan...

text: İmdilik gâvurdan daha tehlikeli olan Ertuğrul'u durdurmak için...
english: To stop Ertuğrul, who is more dangerous than a prisoner of war...
You're not getting rid of me this time.
Come on, the head of the rock.

text: Gel de kimin kime tuzak kurduğunu gör.
english: Come and see who's setting whom up.
...the spy from the fort will come to Helena.
(Leaves) I've had enough, sir, I've had enough!
Did your uncovered wounds hurt, my lord?

text: İmdi ben senin o yaralarını kapayacağım.
english: Now I'm gonna cover up for your wounds.
They also took Commander Teo prisoner.
There were no ammunition in the trailer, sir.

text: Helena, babasına olduğu gibi size de sadık.
english: Helena is loyal to you, as she was to her father.

text: Teo'nun baskın yapacağını bir tek Helena biliyordu!
english: Only Helena knew Teo was going to raid!
He couldn't have told Ertuğrul anything else!
I saw Helena coming out of a store.

text: Dükkânın sahibi, Ertuğrul'un altın madenini emanet ettiği Haçaturyan'dı.
english: The owner of the shop was Khachaturian, who entrusted Ertuğrul's gold mine.

text: Öğrendim ki herkese kendini Alvin Usta diye tanıtırmış.
english: I found out he introduced himself to everyone as Alvin the Master.

text: Bu doğru değil! Ben böyle bir şey yapmadım!
İmdi de son kez Vasilius'a ulaklık edeceksin.
english: And now you will be the last to serve Vasilius.

text: Ural'ın iti Yağız'dan haberim yok mu sanırsın Vasilius?
english: You think I don't know about the Ural's dog, Vasilius?
...it wasn't Helena who said I was going to hit the ammunition.

text: Az kalsın senin yüzünden sevdiğim kadını öldürecektim, bre ahmak!
english: I almost killed the woman I loved because of you, you fool!

text: (Ertuğrul dış ses) Ey ordularını akın akın büyüten Rabbim...
english: My Lord, who has made your hosts flowing.
...and give us a place in your army.
(External shouting) My generation is not to be sad.

text: (Ertuğrul dış ses) Refah yurdunda bize de yer ver.
english: (Shouting out loud) Make us a place in the home of prosperity.
(Extreme noise) Don't let your grass fall to the ground.

text: (Ertuğrul dış ses) Gönlüme cesaret, bileğime güç ver.
english: (External shout) Give courage to my heart, give strength to my wrist.
(Exulting) My desire is to please You.

text: (Ertuğrul dış ses) Kavuşma hayaline yol ver.
english: (External shouting) Make the dream of joining.

text: (Ertuğrul dış ses) Rızan için cenk eden yiğitlerine şanlı bir zafer ver.
english: Give a glorious victory to those who fight for your pleasure.

text: (Ertuğrul dış ses) Beni ve neslimi kutlu davana hizmetkâr eyle.
english: (Exulting) Make me and my generation servants to Your blessed cause.

text: Senin gibi bir ahmakla iş yapanda kabahat!
english: You're a fool to deal with!
I was gonna kill the woman I loved because of you!
To break this alliance between us...

text: Seni dinlediğim için bunlar başıma geldi Ural!
english: I've been through this for listening to you, Ural!

text: Senin askerin yüzünden, senin adamın yüzünden başıma geldi!
english: It's because of your soldier, because of your man!
...a traitor who has leaked the pen...
...you will never know the traitors in this castle!
He still calls me a traitor!
He still calls me a traitor!

text: Babamın dükkânını kiralamak isteyen tüccar siz misiniz?
english: Are you the merchant who wants to rent my father's shop?

text: Daha önce nerede ticaret yapmıştınız Alvin Usta?
english: Where did you trade before, Master Alvin?
I feel like I know you from somewhere.

text: Cihanın dört bir tarafında iş yaptım.
english: I've done work all over the world.
You want to know about Helena, Bams?

text: Çavdar Obası'nda kiminle iş tuttuğunuzu da...
english: And who you're working with in the Sculpture Room...
...and you'll tell us about Helena's fate.

text: ...sizin kalede kiminle iş gördüğünüzü nasıl bulduysak...
english: ...how we found out who you were dealing with at the fort...
...and you're the traitor in the village...
...and find out what it is, Mr. Ertuğrul.
Sir, what does that say to Helena?

text: Bu ite ihtiyacımız yok Ertuğrul Bey'im.
english: We don't need this rat, Mr. Ertuğrul.
It's useless, let's get out of here.

text: Ben zaten öldürdüğünüz askerlerimle beraber öldüm.
english: I already died with my soldiers you killed.

text: Bana bundan sonra hiçbir iyilik de kötülük de yapamazsınız.
english: You can do me no good or harm.
What can you do to save Helena's life...
...and you can't catch the traitor in the village.
There's no easy death for you, Teo.

text: Öldürdüğüm her Bizans askerinden haberin olacak.
english: You'll know about every Byzantine soldier I kill.
I'm gonna make a mountain out of them.

text: Seni de sancak diye tepelerine dikeceğim.
english: I'm gonna put you on top of them to get you to fly.

text: Bu itten daha fazla bir şey öğrenemeyiz.
english: We can't learn anything more from this dog.
...who this dog is dealing with is obvious.
But if we can't prove it...

text: ...her şey o dükkânı kiraladıktan sonra başladı.
english: ...it all started after he rented that store.

text: Tekfur Hazretleri, ne olur onu bırakın.
Babamın altın ustasıydı. Madenlerinin başında o vardı.
english: My father was a goldsmith, he was in charge of the mines.

text: Ertuğrul onu pazardan köle olarak satın aldı.
english: Ertuğrul bought him as a slave at the market.
We saw it with our own eyes!

text: Onu yanına aldı. Yalvarırım inan bize!
Ben de madeni basınca bu işe vermiş.
english: I hit the mine and he gave it to me.

text: Bize kurduğu bu tuzağı birlikte halledelim Tekfur Hazretleri.
english: Let's work together to solve this trap he's setting for us, Your Grace.

text: O bize bir oyun oynadı, biz de ona oynayalım.
english: He played a game for us, let's play it for him.

text: Hâlâ beraber iş yapalım dersin! Hâlâ!
english: You still think we can do business together?

text: Adamların da en az senin kadar ahmak!
english: Your men are as stupid as you are!
You told me they were on my orders.
I said it's not easy to eat.

text: ...içeride bana bağlı Alplerim ve beylerim vardır.
english: ...with my Alps and gentlemen attached to me.
He stole our man from us.

text: Müsaade et, bu işi birlikte çözelim.

english: It's not easy to eat Ertuğrul.

text: Niye ben hep ahmaklarla uğraşmak zorundayım?
english: Why do I always have to deal with fools?
Why do I have to deal with fools?
Take these to their rooms and lock them up.
If Alvin is not a traitor...

text: Bu Alvin Usta'nın ne mal olduğunu nereden öğreneceğiz?
english: How are we gonna find out what this Alvin Master is worth?
Sir, there's a prisoner in prison.
He was the right hand of Hatun's father.

text: O dönem kalede kim var kim yok, o bilir.
english: He knows who was in the castle at the time.
He's the only one who knows Alvin.
I'm the one who's the bad guy!
If you'd hit his head, split it in two!

text: Ah be Bamsı! Ah be Bamsı! Ne durursun? Ne durursun?
english: Oh, my God, what are you doing?

text: Beyim, beyim, kurbanın olayım koyuveresin beni.
english: Sir, sir, I'm gonna have to get on with the victim.
Helena's life is in danger, her condition is uncertain.

text: Duymaz mısın iti beyim? Öldürecek onu der!

english: What did we talk to you about, Bamshi?
Anger has caused us a lot of trouble.
Teo doesn't know about the Fat Dog.
Vasilius, when he saw the body of the Fat Dog...
(Erturghul) He will not respect the words of the Urals.
Helena's not in trouble, the Ural is.

text: Yani Helena iyidir dersin değil mi beyim?
english: So you think Helena is good, don't you, sir?

text: İyidir. Hem Teo, Yağız itini gönderdiğimizi de bilmez.
english: And Teo doesn't know we sent the Fat Dog.
He's right, he's good, he's good.
...until I see him so bloody, alive...
...bears are in my throat, my brain never stops.
Oh, my God, if you'll excuse me.
Sir, you ordered me to go to school.
I have to talk to you yesterday.
Hey, Polly, good luck with that, Polly.

text: Ne oldu usta? Ne tepişip durursun yine?

english: They say he put Helena in jail.
It's a dry noise, I don't know if it's true.
Why would he throw it in jail?

text: Nereden bileyim? İhtiyar kulaklarımın duyduğu bu kadar.
english: That's all my old ears hear.

text: Dur hele dur. İşin aslını öğrenelim hele.
Hemen öğren. Hemen öğren ki Ertuğrul Bey'imize haber edelim. Hadi.
english: Find out now, and we'll call our lord Ertuğrul.

text: Bu adama iyi bak. Tanır mısın?
english: Take a good look at this guy.

text: Eski Tekfur'un devrinde bundan zengini yoktu.
english: He wasn't rich like that in the time of the ancient Tekafur.
She's too old, but these moustaches...
It's none of your business, man.
(Vasilius) My anger has blinded my eyes, blind.

text: Sana itimat etmeyerek aşkıma ihanet ettim!
english: I betrayed my love by not trusting you!
...you're convinced of the innocence of the woman you're about to marry?

text: Bana yaptıklarının hiçbirini hak etmedim Vasilius.
english: I didn't deserve anything you did to me, Vasilius.

text: Nasıl benim o Türklerin, o uğursuz Türklerin oyuncağı olduğumu düşünürsün?
english: How can you think I'm a toy of those Turks, those unfortunate Turks?

text: Şimdi de geçmiş karşıma, benden af dilersin.
english: Now, you're gonna have to apologize to me for the past.
Tell me, how can I forgive you?

text: Bana sadece bir fırsat daha ver Helena.
english: Just give me one more chance, Helena.

text: Sana layık biri olduğumu ispat edeceğim.
english: I'll prove I'm worthy of you.
Don't look at me with these tears and...
...do not be angry with yourself, Vasilius.

text: ...bizi birbirimize düşman eden Ertuğrul'a güvendiğim için.
english: ...because I trusted Ertuğrul, who is our enemy.
I'm going to my father's castle and...
...for deceiving the men who murdered our commanders.
How can I be mad at you?
...the storm will finally find its way.
What kind of woman are you, Helena?
Because he gave you to me...

text: İşte bir komutanın karısına da bu yakışır.
english: That's what a commander's wife is for.
Let's get out of this awful place.
You're as young as a lion.
Your blood is flowing crazy, I know.

text: Bundan gayrı gönlün de başka çarpacak.
english: And your heart will be broken.

text: Seni baş göz etmenin vakti geldi Dündar.
english: It's time to look after you, Dunder.

text: Lakin gönül işleri aceleye gelmez kardeşim.
english: But heart matters don't come in a hurry, brother.
Brother, why are you saying that now?
I had a moment in my mind.
There's no rose from the bottom of hell, brother.
Before the smoke from our heads...
...not to interfere with the affairs of the heart.

text: Hele ki senin gibi yiğit bir beye varmak için...
english: Especially to get to a brave gentleman like you...
I'm not gonna do anything to get you down.

text: Hep obanı, beyini, töreni düşünerek iş yaptın.
english: You've always done it with your mind, your brain, your ceremony in mind.

text: Yanlış insanlarla yanlış işler yapmayasın Dündar'ım.
english: Don't do the wrong thing with the wrong people, Dunder.
You have nothing else to say...
Hey, man, I got a little nerve.
Yeah, see what you got, lion.
(Sighs) Do you have a record, sir?
Come on, Mr. Artuk, you know what?
- I'm going to be a little late.
The man from our sultan's Nikea has arrived, sir.
- He just wants to see you.

text: Obaya yakındır. Çalı başında seni bekler.
english: He's near the mansion, waiting for you in the grass.

text: Gittiğimden kimsenin haberi olmasın Artuk Bey.
english: Don't let anyone know I'm gone, Mr. Artuk.
You know, you're a fucking idiot!
He got it all in his face.
...that he wouldn't respect what I said.

text: Er geç sözlerimizin doğru olduğunu öğrenecektir.
english: He'll know soon enough that we're telling the truth.

text: Sana mecbur olduğunu daha da iyi anlayacaktır beyim.
english: He'll understand better that you have to, sir.
In the case of the Crusaders...
Thanks to you, I found the traitor in the pen.

text: Helena'nın yanına gidin ve onu teselli edin...
english: Go to Helena and comfort her...
He put his dagger in to the pen!

text: Attığım her adımı takip etti ama buraya kadar.
english: He followed me every step of the way, but this is it.

text: Artık casusları, benim gözüm kulağım olacak.
english: Now, spies, I'll be my eye for an ear.
...will be honored on the gold peak.

text: ...tek bir hata daha istemem Ural Bey.
english: I don't want another mistake, Mr. Ural.
...like a dog that has run before Ertugrul...
...unless you raise the flag of the guard...
I'm not gonna let you die.

text: ...Türk saldırılarına karşı birlik göndermeyi kabul etmiş efendim.
english: ...he has agreed to send troops against the Turkish attacks, sir.
They'll be in the fort in a few days.

text: Gelen birlikler bize Türk obalarına saldıracak gücü verecektir.
english: The incoming troops will give us the strength to attack Turkish villages.
- Who is Vuslat? - He's in his homeland.

text: (Erkek) Cihan, vatanın olsun. Alem sana yâr olsun.
english: (Man) The world, your homeland, and the world, yours.

text: Tekfur Vasilius, imparatoruna bir mektup yazdı.
english: Tekfur Vasilius wrote a letter to the emperor.
The Turks broke the peace and started the war...
...that he had imprisoned him and killed his soldiers.
And you went into the fortress and hanged your commanders.

text: Bu durum Nikea'da infial yarattı. Halk baskıyı arttırdı.
english: This has inflicted infidelity on Nikea, and increased public pressure.
The Emperor couldn't stand the pressure, either.

text: İmparator akıllı biridir. Adamını çok iyi tanır.
english: The Emperor is a smart man, he knows his man very well.

text: Vasilius'un savaş başlatmak için bahane aradığını bilir.
english: He knows that Vasilius is looking for an excuse to start a war.
He hasn't listened much so far.

text: Çünkü sulhu bozmak için güçlü bir sebep yoktu.
english: Because there was no strong reason to disrupt the reconciliation.

text: Lakin handa ve kalede olanlardan sonra...
english: But after the hound and the castle...

text: ...işin aslını araştırmak ve baskıyı azaltmak için bir birlik gönderdi.
english: ...sending a team to investigate the case and reduce the pressure.

text: Demek imparator da savaşı durduramayacağını anladı.
english: So the emperor realized he couldn't stop the war.
The soldiers he sent were not for investigation...
How many soldiers does the Emperor need...

text: ...Türklerin ahvali nedir, ne kadar dirayet gösterir bilmek ister.
english: ...what the Turks are doing, how much resistance they show.

text: (Erkek) Eğer umduğu gibi zayıf Türk obası bulursa...
english: (Man) If he finds the weak Turkish village as he hopes...

text: Bizi bu çok mühim savaş hattında…
english: We're on this very important battle line...

text: …şerefinle ve var gücünle temsil ettin Ertuğrul Bey'im. Var olasın.
english: ...you represented me with all your honour and power, my lord Ertuğrul.

text: Sen olmasaydın Karacahisar güçlenir, fetih zora girerdi.
english: If it hadn't been for you, Karachahisar would have been stronger, the conquest would have been difficult.

text: Alnının akıyla bu vazifeyi ifa ettin.
english: You've done this job with your head.
We need to get this information to our sultan.

text: Bu bilgi en kısa zamanda sultanımıza ulaştırılacaktır.
english: This information will be transmitted to our sultan as soon as possible.

text: Gayrı vazife senindir. Allah yardımcın olsun.
english: The best is for you, God be your helper.
I'm going to be a little late.

text: Canım kuzenim. Ne oldu sana böyle?
english: My dear cousin, what happened to you?
How can he do this to you?
Can a man fuck the woman he's gonna marry?

text: Aksi takdirde Vasilius asla bana kıyamazdı.
english: Otherwise, Vasilius would never have been able to bite me.
He took away the pain of the traitor in the fortress.

text: Senin yaralı kalbini nasıl teselli edecek bakalım.
english: Let's see how he can comfort your wounded heart.
He's having a tough time, Choolpan.

text: Hem onun yerinde kim olsa aynı şüpheyi duyardı.
english: And whoever was in his shoes would have the same suspicion.
Oh, Helena, you are so good.

text: Keşke hayat senin gördüğün gibi masum ve güzel olsaydı.
english: I wish life was as innocent and beautiful as you see it.
It's about how you see the Runner.

text: Hem insan içinde iyilik biriktirmezse nasıl mutlu olur ki?
english: And how can he be happy if he doesn't store up goodness in himself?

text: Haklısın. Lakin sen de bilirsin ki her şey karşılıklıdır.
english: You're right, but you know everything is reciprocal.

text: Umarım Vasilius kıymetini bilir de aynı hatayı tekrarlamaz.
english: I hope Vasilius knows his value and doesn't make the same mistake again.

text: Şüphen olmasın. O benim kıymetimi bilecektir.
Yüzünden düşen bin parça. Pek bir düşüncelisin Dündar Bey.
english: Thousands of pieces falling from your face.

text: Yok bir şeyim, Günyeli Hatun. Dalgınım biraz.
english: I'm all right, daylight savvy, I'm a little bit distracted.
But you don't want to tell me.
I'm not happy with it, Daily Hatun.

text: Benimle konuşmak istemezsen anlarım. Üstüne gelmem.
english: I understand if you don't want to talk to me.
...sometimes they can be worse than the enemy.

text: Düşmanlarımız pusu kurarlar, pusatlarıyla üzerimize gelirler.
english: Our enemies are ambushing us, they're coming at us with their hubs.

text: Benim yüzümden birileri üstüne geldi değil mi?
english: Somebody got on you because of me, didn't they?
They don't want you to talk to me, do they?
Don't worry, I'm used to being excluded because of my dad.

text: Benim yüzümden ağabeyinle aran açılsın istemem.
english: I don't want you and your brother getting into trouble for me.

text: Günyeli, ben seversem, cihan üstüme gelse vazgeçmem.
english: I'm not going to give up if I like it, if I get the hang of it.
No one can hurt you when I'm with you.

text: Haa, üzenlerin de karşısına dikilmeyi biliriz evelallah.
english: Yeah, we can stand up to the hurt, too.

text: Seni karşıma Allah çıkardı Dündar Bey'im.
english: God has brought you up against me, Mr. Dunder.

text: Hatunlar. Hepinizin eline sağlık. Gayrı birkaç günlük iş kalmıştır.
english: Ladies, congratulations to all of you, we've got a few days left to go.

text: Allah hepinizden razı olsun. Sizlerle gurur duyuyorum.
english: God bless you all. I'm proud of you.

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Allah razı olsun Aslıhan Hatun.
english: (Every one of them) with Allah's pleasure, Aslihan Hathon.
We're all going to take a leave of absence tomorrow.
You're so tired, you deserve this.

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Sağ olasın Hayme Ana. Allah razı olsun.
english: (Praise be to Allah) and praise be to Allah.
Come on, girls, easy on the head.

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Sağ olasın Dündar Bey'im.
Hayrola evlat, niye bu kadar mahzunsun?
english: Wow, son, why are you so upset?

text: Ana, ben size Günyeli meselesini abime demeyin demedim mi?
english: Didn't I tell you not to tell my brother about the daily business?

text: Sakin ol oğul. Ne oldu anlat hele.
english: Calm down, son, tell me what happened.

text: Yengem, Günyeli meselesini abime söylemiş, ana.
english: Yengem told my brother about the daily business, Mom.

text: Abim de bu meseleden dolayı beni payladı.
english: My brother split me up for this.
He doesn't want me to marry the day-old.
Ma, first of all, this is what they did in the training camp...

text: …imdi de bu söyledikleri benim ağırıma gider.
english: ...and now I'm gonna take it upon myself to say that.
It's going to weigh on me.

text: Nedir mesele? Nedir bu Dündar Bey'imin hâli?
english: What's the matter, what's the matter with Mr. Dunder?

text: Halime, ben sana Ertuğrul'a Günyeli meselesini söyleme demedim mi?
english: Halime, didn't I tell you not to tell Ertuğrul about the daily affair?

text: Ana, obanın beyidir Ertuğrul. Ben ondan bir şey saklayamam.
english: Ana, Ertuğrul is the master of the village.

text: Hatunluk, her diline geleni söylemek değildir!
english: The woman is not to say what she can!
It's a measure and a measure, and it's a timing.

text: İmdiden sıkıntılar baş göstermeye başladı. Ne yapacağız?
english: The trouble is starting to happen.

text: Dua edelim de daha kötü olmasın.
english: Let's just pray it's not worse.

text: Yoksa hepimiz çok ağır öderiz bunun bedelini.
english: Or we'll all pay too much for it.

text: Dündar ile Doğan'a tez haber sal, yanıma gelsinler.
english: Call yesterday and Dagan and tell them to come to me.
You're the one who orders it, sir.
Why do you like a castle?

text: Surları vardır aşılmaz, askerleri vardır geçilmez.
english: There are walls that cannot be broken, there are soldiers that cannot be broken.

text: Ah seveydin, seveydin şöyle dağların kızını…
english: Oh, you loved it, you loved the mountain girl...
...you would have thrown it on your back.

text: Bakın hele imdi dağların ayısına ne edeceğim.
english: Look what I'm gonna do to the big mountain bear.
You're totally out of your mind.
Now you can smell the baking.
I'm not a baker, I'm Teo.

text: Gelirsin Doğan. Sana ne edeyim ben, gelirsin.
english: You're coming, Daggan, whatever I do for you, you're coming.

text: Dur, sinirlenmeyesin. Şurada iki gülelim dedik yahu.
english: Wait, don't get mad, we said two laughs over there.

text: Ya buldunuz aklı havada adamı, gülersiniz.
english: You find the man in the mood, you laugh.

text: Gayrı yüzün gülsün Bamsı. Eski hâllerini özledik.
english: Your face is smiling, Bams, we miss your old self.
And look what I got you.

text: Hem de adını Teo koydum. Afiyetle yiyesin.

english: I'm gonna eat Teo like that.
It's all going to pass, brother.

text: Hem Ertuğrul Bey'imin söz verip de tutmadığı görülmüş mü hiç?
english: Has it ever been seen that Mr. Ertuğrul has made a promise or not?
We're going to have your wedding.
We'll cook a pot full of potatoes.
We're gonna get your ass in the barn.

text: E tabii. Senin için pastırmalar hazırlayacağız.
Sonra onları düğününde ben sana yedireceğim.
english: Then I'll feed them to you at your wedding.

text: Ya kardeş, şu nimete başka isim veremez miydin?
english: Brother, could you name that blessing any other way?
I say hi to the Alps.
- I'm going to be a little late.

text: Ertuğrul Bey'im sizi ve Doğan Alp'i çağırır.
english: My lord Ertuğrul calls you and the Dagan Alps.

text: Sende bir hâller var Halime Hatun. Kuyu gibi sessizsin.
english: You have a situation, Halime Hatun, you're quiet as a well.
He's not gonna have a word.

text: Lakin yüzüne sirayet eden yorgunluğun hüznü değildir.
english: But it's not the sorrow of fatigue that's staring at your face.
You're gonna get drunk on the daily business again?

text: Bu mesele gayrı benim de boyumu aşar.
Kuyu gibi sessiz kalmak en iyisi.
english: It's best to be quiet like a well.
Tell me, what did he do?
(forty) Is there a record of Aslihan Hatun?

text: Konya'dan bir haberci geldi. Sizi görmek ister Aslıhan Hatun.
english: A reporter from Konya wants to see you.

text: Bu mektup, Emir Sadettin Hazretlerinden size gönderilmiştir.
english: This letter is sent to you from His Majesty Emir Sadettin.

text: Dündar, Doğan. Size çok mühim bir vazife düştü.
english: Yesterday, Doğan, you have a very important assignment.

text: Yarın sabah erkenden yola düşüp Konya'ya varacaksınız.
english: You will leave early tomorrow morning and arrive in Konya.
You will convey a message to our sultan.
You're the one who orders it, sir.
We're not gonna write what I'm going to say in a letter.

text: Kötü bir haber mi vardır, ne oldu?
english: Is there bad news, what happened?

text: ...anasıyla tanış olmam için beni Ilgın'a çağırır.
english: ...he invites me to Ilgin to meet his mother.
He says he should do the wedding preparations here.
What do you think you're gonna do?
I don't know what I was thinking, Halime Hatun.

text: Belki de gitmem en iyisi olacak.

english: Why are you shadowed, Daylight Sailor?

text: Neden kara bulutlar sarar güzel çehreni?
english: Why do black clouds turn yellow, you beautiful face?

text: Benim yüzümden ağabeyinle aran açılsın istemem.
english: I don't want you and your brother getting into trouble for me.

text: Ama merak etmeyesin, sen yanımda oldukça daha iyi olacağım.
english: But don't worry, I'll be much better off with you.

text: İnşallah sen bir bey hatunu olacaksın. Dirayetli olmalısın.
english: I hope you're a gentleman's mate, you must be resilient.
When do you say it's going to happen?

text: Lakin bazı mühim işlerim var. Yarın sabah yola düşeceğim.
english: But I have some important things to do, and I'm leaving tomorrow morning.

text: Onu halledip döndükten sonra ilk işim abimle konuşmak olacak.
english: After I get him back, my first job is to talk to my brother.
I mean, I'm not gonna see you.

text: Çok uzaklara gitmem, merak etmeyesin. Kısa sürede dönerim.
english: I'm not going too far, don't worry.

text: Ben seni daha sık görürüm diye ümitlenirken…
english: While I'm hoping to see you more often...
...you will be in my heart and in my mind.
Just be a little more patient.
Don't forget me wherever you go.

text: Yanımda bu mendil oldukça bırak Konya'ya…
english: Leave this to Konya as long as I have this towel...
...even if I go to Fizan, I will never forget you.

text: Günyeli, bu gayrı ikimizin arasında bir sırdır.
english: Daily, this gap is a secret between us.
Don't worry, sir, my mouth is sealed.

text: Senin de gözlerin mühürlü olsun. Orada başka hatunları görmesin.
english: You have to keep your eyes sealed so she can't see any other girls.

text: Benim gözlerim seni gördüğünden beri mühürlüdür zaten.
english: My eyes have been sealed since I saw you.
When I get back, everything will be different.
What were you talking to Dündar about?
He's here to say goodbye to me, Dad.

text: Mühim bir vazife için Konya'ya gidecekmiş.
english: He's going to Konya for an important mission.

text: -Güle güle gidesin Ertuğrul Bey'im. -Eyvallah Aliyar Bey.
english: - Bye bye to you, my lord Ertuğrul.
Teo's dog is in your hands.

text: Acar Bey'in de işlerini tez vakitte öğrenmemiz gerek.
english: We need to learn Mr. Acar's business as soon as possible.

text: Acar'ı her daim takip ettirmekteyim, Ertuğrul Bey.
english: I keep following Acar all the time, Mr. Ertuğrul.
Don't worry, I'm watching every step of the way.

text: -Allah'a emanet olasın Aliyar Bey. -Sizler de beyim.
Gayrı Ertuğrul Bey ile Aliyar Bey'in zulmüne son verme vakti gelmiştir.
english: It's time to end the oppression of Gayri Ertuğrul Bey and Aliyar Bey.

text: Ural Bey'imizin tekrar obamızın başına geçmesi için ne lazımsa yapacağız.
english: We will do whatever it takes to get our Ural lord back to our village.

text: Ural Bey'i başımıza getirelim derken kendi başımızdan olacağız.
english: We're going to be on our own if we get Mr. Ural.

text: Merak etme. Ellerinde hiçbir delil yok.
english: Don't worry, they have no proof.

text: Sadece şüpheyle, zanla bir şey elde edemezler.
english: They can only doubt, and they can only suspect.

text: Öyle dahi olsa obada kaç kişi kaldık.
english: How many of us are still in the village?

text: Gözümüzün önünde bir bir Alplerimizi katlederler.
english: They're slaughtering an Alpine in front of us.

text: Ural Bey diğer Türkmen beylerinin desteğini arkasına almıştır.
english: Mr. Ural has the support of other Turkmen gentlemen.

text: Onların da desteğiyle Çavdar Obası hak ettiği beyine kavuşacaktır.
english: With their help, the Craftsman's gonna get the brains he deserves.
Just have a little more patience.

text: Evvela halletmemiz gereken başka bir mesele vardır.
english: There's another matter we need to deal with first.

text: Konya'ya gitmelerinin ardında mühim bir sebep olmalı.
english: There must be a big reason they went to Konya.
We need to report this to Mr. Ural.

text: Lakin benim peşimde de Aliyar'ın Alpleri vardır.
english: But I'm also chased by the Alps of the Allies.

text: Bu haberi Ural Bey'e sen vereceksin.
Ben senden evvel ava çıkıp peşimdeki adamları başka yere çekeceğim.
english: I'll hunt you down before I do, and I'll drag the men behind me somewhere else.

text: Sen de Karacahisar'a varıp, Dündar Bey'in Konya'ya gideceğini iletesin.
english: You should go to Karajahisar and tell him that Mr. Dunder is going to Konya.
Aslihan, are you all right, sister?
A letter from Emir Sadettin has arrived.

text: Düğün hazırlıkları için beni Ilgın'a davet eder.
english: He invites me to Ilgin for the wedding preparations.
Our Sultan asked for the wedding to be held there.

text: Bacım, eğer bu işte gönlün yoksa ben sonuna kadar arkandayım.
english: Sister, if you don't have the heart to do this, I'll be right behind you.
You don't have to marry Sadettin the Dog.

text: Kaderin okuna kalkan tutulmaz abi. Bu benim kaderimdir.
english: The arrow of fate is the shield of my destiny, brother.

text: Müsaade edersen yarın Kayı Obası'na gidip onlarla vedalaşmak isterim.
english: If you'll excuse me, I'd like to go to the Scuba Diving Hall tomorrow and say goodbye to them.

text: Nicedir Dündar'ımın yüzünü böyle güleç görmemiştim.
english: I've never seen Nicedir Dundar's face so glowing.

text: Gönlüne düşen alev gözlerini parlatıyordu yavrumun.
english: The flame in his heart was glowing in his eyes, my baby.
It's clear that the fire has come down on Dundar.

text: Lakin bu işler istişare etmeden olur mu ana?
english: But can these things be done without consultation, Mother?
Will he obey the commands, son?

text: Sen Halime Sultan'a gönül verdiğinde hangimizle istişare ettin?
english: When you gave your consent to Halime Sultan, which one of us did you consult?
What matters is my Dundar's happiness.
Mom, that's another one, this one.

text: Yaşadıklarımızın tamamına evvela Allah, sonra sen şahitsin.
english: God is the first witness to all that we have been through, and then you are the witness.
I'm going to take care of it.

text: Bu meseleye daha sonra bakacağız ana.
english: We'll deal with this later, Mom.

text: İmdi Dündar ile Doğan'ın yapması gereken mühim bir vazife vardır.
english: Now Dunder and Dugan have an important task to do.
They won't be here for a while.

text: Bu vazife mühimdir. Ondan başkasına güvenemem.
english: This is a very important job, and I can't trust anyone else.

text: Hem Dündar'ın da bir süre buradan uzak olması iyi olur.
english: And Dundar better be out of here for a while.

text: Ertuğrul Bey'e Helena'nın zindanda olduğunu söylemeye.
english: To tell Mr. Ertuğrul that Helena is in prison.

text: Sadece o değil. Kalede kurduğumuz düzen de yakında ifşa olur.
english: Not only that, but the order we've set up in the castle will soon be exposed.

text: Görürüm ki Ertuğrul Bey'imden yediğin azar seni pek bir fena yapmış.
english: I see that the little you ate from my lord Ertuğrul made you very bad.

text: Hani kanatların olsa Ertuğrul Bey'imin yanına uçacaksın.
english: You'd fly to my lord Ertuğrul if you had wings.
I don't have time to be funny, master.

text: Onu zindandan çıkarmış. Prensesler gibi odasına götürmüş.
english: He took her out of prison, into her room like a princess.

text: Lakin Ertuğrul Bey'imiz Yağız itinin cesedini kaleye yollayınca…
english: But when our lord Ertuğrul sent the body of the Fat Dog to the castle...
He thought he was wrong, Vasilius.
Thank God you got it, son.

text: Ertuğrul Bey'imizin aklı tam zamanında gelmiş.
english: Our Lord Ertuğrul has come to his senses just in time.

text: Yoksa kızın hâli pek bir fena olurdu.
english: Otherwise, she'd be in a really bad shape.

text: Belki de bizim olurdu Haçaturyan Usta.
english: Maybe we could have the Crusader Master.

text: Bizim de üzerimizdeki kuşku kalkmış oldu çok şükür.
english: Thank God we've had our doubts.
We'd lose our position at the fort.

text: Al bakalım sen şu süpürgeyi. Dükkânı güzelce bir temizle.
english: You take that brush and clean the shop.

text: Kalenin bütün kiri pası dükkâna sinmiş.
english: The whole castle's dirt rusted into the shop.
If you're a jerk, you know your jerk.

text: Ben de yoruldum. Gidip biraz kestireyim.
english: I'm tired too, so I'll go and take a nap.
I was sent by Mr. Acar, sir.

text: O Acar'a söyle, obaya döndüğümde benden çekeceği var.
english: Tell that Acar, when I get back to the village, he'll have to pull me.
I was almost killed by her.
Ertuğrul has learned about the oil.

text: Yarın Konya'ya gidecekmiş. Size iletmemi söyledi.
english: He's going to Konya tomorrow, and he told me to tell you.

text: Dündar Bey, Acar Bey'in kızı Günyeli Hatun'a söylemiş beyim.
english: Yesterday, I told the daughter of Mr. Acar to Mr. Hattun.

text: Dündar'ın Günyeli Hatun'la ne işi ola ki?
english: What's Dündar got to do with the Daily Hatun?

text: Dündar Bey, Günyeli Hatun'a vurgun derler beyim.
english: Yesterday, sir, they call the Daily Hatun a hit.

text: Sık sık görüşürlermiş. Veda etmeye gittiğinde söylemiş.
english: He said he saw her often when she went to say goodbye.

text: Demek bizim küçük bey âşık olmuş ha.
english: So our little guy is in love.

text: Tam da kendine göre bir hatun bulmuş.
english: He just found a girl for himself.

text: Teo, beyim. Çavdar Obası'nda mahkûm çadırına attılar, sorgularlar.
english: Teo, sir, they put him in a tent in the Shipyard, interrogating him.

text: O Acar'a söyle bu gece ne yapıp edip Teo'yu kaçırsın.
english: Tell that Acar what he's doing tonight to get Teo.

text: …eğer bu Konya meselesi de tuzak çıkarsa kendine mezar baksın.
english: ...if this Konya thing is a trap, let him look for his own grave.
It's the same as the first one.

text: Ne o Ural, dayanamadın mı yemeğe kadar?
english: What, that Urals, you couldn't stand it till you ate?
When you hear what I've learned, you're not gonna be able to stand it?
If you use it for good...
...how do you say, you'd be married, Ural, married.
- Until my father gets back-- - We got it, we got it.

text: Anlat bakalım azimli kurt. Nasıl alacağız intikamımızı?
english: Tell me, you determined wolf, how are we going to get our revenge?

text: Ertuğrul'un kardeşi Dündar Bey yarın Konya'ya gidecekmiş.
english: Dunder Bey, Ertuğrul's brother, is going to Konya tomorrow.

text: Sultana gidiyor. Demek ki önemli bir bilgi verecek.
english: He's going to the Sultan, so he's going to give us some important information.

text: Tabii bu da Ertuğrul'un sana attığı bir yem değilse.
english: Unless this is a bait Ertuğrul threw at you.

text: O iş bir kere olur Vasilius. Neden bana itimat etmezsin?
english: That's a one-time thing, Vasilius, why don't you trust me?

text: Sana Ertuğrul'un kardeşi Dündar'ı altın tepside sunuyorum.
english: I present you Dundar, Ertuğrul's brother, on a gold platter.

text: Hiçbir şey yapmadan böylece oturacak mısın orada?
english: You're gonna sit there like that and do nothing?

text: Burada hiçbir şey yapmadan öylece otursam Ural…
english: If I just sit here and do nothing, the Ural...
I'm sure I'd lose fewer men.

text: Senin peşine düştüğüm her vakit burnum pislikten kurtulmadı.
english: Every time I've been after you, my nose hasn't been clean.

text: Beni de götür. Eğer bu bir tuzaksa orada öldürürsün beni.
english: If this is a trap, you'll kill me there.

text: Sana Haçaturyan'ı getirdim. İmdi de Dündar'ı getiriyorum.
english: I brought you the Khachaturyan, and now I bring Dunder.

text: Lakin Alplerime emir verdim, onu bu gece kurtaracaklar.
english: But I have ordered my Alps to rescue him tonight.

text: Onu kurtarırsan dile benden ne dilersen.
english: If you save her, say whatever you want from me.

text: Dündar'ı almamız yeter. İntikamını almamız yeter.
english: We've got to take Dundar, we've got to get revenge.

text: Ayrıca sultana giden bilgiyi de öğrenmiş olacağız.
english: We'll also have information that goes to the sultan.

text: Sen de benimle geleceksin. Eğer bu bir tuzak çıkarsa…
english: You're coming with me, and if this becomes a trap...
(Applause) May I have a moment, sir?

text: Beyim, Acar Bey'in ardına taktığım Alp geldi.
english: Sir, the Alp I've been following Mr. Acar is here.

text: Bugün ava gitmiş. Kimseyle görüşmemiş. Fazla da uzaklaşmamış.
english: He went hunting today, didn't see anyone, didn't go far.

text: Hangi dağda kurt ölmüş de Acar ava gitmiş Kutluca?
english: On what mountain did the wolf die and the Acar went hunting?

text: Av onlarda işaret oldu. Bu işin içinde bir bit yeniği var.
english: They've got a little bit of a newbie in this.
You can keep following, thank you.

text: Obada kiminle görüşür onu da takip edin.
english: Follow whoever he's meeting in the room.

text: Kendi gitmiyor, lakin birini gönderiyor olabilir.
english: He's not going alone, but he might be sending someone.
We need to get Teo out of here before we waste any time.
How many people are in charge?

text: İki kişi var beyim. Kutluca da sık sık girip bakar.
english: There's two people, sir, and the blessed one comes in and looks around.
We'll get this done with food.

text: Teo'ya giden ekmeğin arasına keski saklayın.
english: Put the dough in the bread that goes to Teo.

text: Kutluca Alp her şeye bakar. Ya keskiyi bulursa?
english: Blessed Alp, he'll look into everything.

text: Ondan dolayı ekmeğin arasına saklayın dedim.
english: That's why I said, "Keep it in the bread".

text: Ellerini çözdükten sonra kapıdaki Alpleri Teo halleder.
english: Teo will take care of the Alps at the door.

text: Obadan çıkarken de bizim Alpler görmezden gelip yol versinler.
english: And when you leave the village, let our Alps ignore you and lead you.
Oh, my God, my God, my God.

text: Sizleri böyle bir arada görmek ne güzel.
english: It's good to see you guys together like this.
And a circumcision of the Prophet's lord...
...to be a part of the ring.

text: Lakin vakit ilerledikçe bu halkada boşluklar meydana geliyordu.
english: But as time went on, gaps were breaking out.

text: Bunun nedeni, bazı sahabelerin gaza meydanlarında...
english: That's because some fields have gas fields...
...some of them were martyred by the persecution of the pagans.
This is one of our companion masters...
...by giving up his property, his life, his family...

text: Uhud gazasında efendimizin mübarek canını muhafaza etmek için...
english: To preserve the blessed life of our lord in the Gaza of Uhud...

text: Peygamber efendimizi Mekke'de müşfiklere karşı koruyan...
english: The Prophet who protected our lord from the pagan in Mecca...

text: ...ona en çok destek veren amcası Hazreti Hamza...
english: ...his uncle, Hamza, who was his biggest supporter...
...he was martyred in the Uhud War.

text: Efendimize en çok benzeyen sahabelerden biri olan...
english: One of the most similar fields to our master...
...Cafer bin Abu Talib is the first to...
...he was martyred in the Mutte War.

text: Allah'ın da sizi cennetinde bir arada kılmasını istiyorsanız...
english: If you want God to bring you together in Paradise...
...you must be ready to testify at all times.
There is no separation for the believers.

text: Zira Bakara suresinde Rabbimiz buyurur ki...
english: For our Lord says in the Surah of Bakara,
"Do not call dead those who are killed in the way of Allah.

text: ...hepimize şehadet şerbeti içmeyi nasip etsin inşallah.
english: ...and I hope he will give us all the testimony wine.
The testimony is not for everyone.

text: Şehadet, canından, malından, nefsinden vazgeçenlerin makamıdır.
english: The witness is the place of those who give up their lives, their wealth and their souls.

text: "Anam babam sana feda olsun Ya Resulullah"...
english: "My mother and father, O Messenger of Allah,
I'll give you anything for your blessed case.
...the place of those who never turn away.

text: O mübarek insanların uğruna şehit oldukları dava...
english: The case for the blessed people who were martyred...
(Earth) They will be honoured with their faces

text: ...Allah, bizleri de o kutlu davanın neferleri eylesin.
english: ...may God bless us with the blessings of this case.
I'm going to be a little late.
I'm going to be a little late.
Well, thank you, Chief, they sent your food.
Keep an eye on this dog.
How did this dog get away, Blessed?
What about Mr. Ertuğrul if he escaped?
You'll be on your way in the morning.
Let go of that bag of cross.
You're back on the job, Daggan.
You don't say what your job is.

text: Ya bu da Karacahisar vazifesi gibi olursa?
english: What if it's like a Karachahisar's job?

text: Ben Ertuğrul Bey'imin menziline baş koyduğumda...
english: When I have entered the range of Mr. Ertuğrul...
I also risked being a martyr.

text: Yerimden, yurdumdan, yârimden ayrı kalmayı da.
english: And to be away from my place, my home, my land.
...that our baby doesn't migrate like we do.

text: Ayaklarını ata yurduna, kendi toprağına sapasağlam, sımsıkı basabilmesi.
english: He can set foot in his own country, his own land, with his feet firmly set.

text: Bu sefer öyle uzun sürmeyecek. Tez vakitte gidip geleceğim evelallah.
Sağ salim git, sağ salim dön inşallah.
english: Go on, I hope you get back safe.
I'll put up with your absence again.
I'm proud of you, black eye.
...to wait so long, to be patient.
...come back before this baby is born, Daggan.

text: Gözünü açtığında ilk seni görsün isterim.
english: I'd like to see you first when you open your eyes.

text: Maazallah gözünü ilk açtığında Bamsı emmisini görürse...
english: God, if he sees his Bamshi sucking when he first opens his eyes...

text: Ee, gel bakalım seni Bamsı emmin bir sevsin.
english: Well, come on, let's see if she loves you.
Come on, I'll show you my pips.
God be your helper and helper.

text: Emanetini hem aklımıza hem kalbimize kazıdık beyim.
english: We've carved your trust into our minds and hearts, sir.
Don't worry, we'll get it to your owner.

text: Düşmanın gölgesi, fesadın türlüsü ilişmesin ötenize berinize.
english: Let not the shadow of the enemy, the kind of corruption, touch you.
I hope you'll be back safe.

text: Tez gidip döneceğiz beyimin emrettiği yerden.
english: We'll go back soon from where my master ordered us.
God be your helper and helper.
Don't let the roads get to you, brother.

text: Eliniz boş gelirseniz benden çekeceğiniz var bilesiniz.
english: You know, you're gonna have to pull me out if you come empty.
I'll sacrifice my mother to you.

text: Bebemiz önce Allah'a, sonra sana emanettir.
english: Our baby is entrusted to God first, then to you.
...go back to the water, my children.
Where did he get the cut, Lucky?

text: Ben de anlamadım beyim. Çadıra girerken üzerini aradım.
english: I didn't understand, sir, I called you on the way to the tent.

text: Kullanmasın diye fare gibi uzattığı tırnaklarını bile kestirdim.
english: I even cut off her nails, like a mouse, so she wouldn't be used.
So where did he get the gun?

text: En güvendiğim Alpleri eşiğine koydum beyim.
english: I've put my trust on the edge of the Alps, sir.
What about those who came out of the tent?

text: Sadece su ve azık getirdi Alpler.
english: He only brought water and food, Alps.

text: Getirdikleri azığı, önüne koydukları her şeyi bizzat ben denetledim.
english: I personally checked the food they brought, everything they put in front of them.
You can step up the precautions, thank you.
Even the food you feed the cat...

text: Abi, belki de o adamın üstünde gizli bir keski vardı.
english: Brother, maybe there was a hidden secret over that man.
With all the trouble in my Obama...

text: ...bir de kendimi avutacak hâlim yok Aslıhan.
english: I'm not in a position to help myself, Aslihan.

text: Bu işin içinde bir iş var.

english: I'll wait for your sultan for a while, Mr. Dunder.

text: Seninle konuşmam gereken mühim meseleler var.
english: I have important matters to talk to you about.

text: Bu soysuz Konya'ya gideceğimizi nereden bilir beyim?
english: How do you know we're going to this clumsy Konya, sir?

text: Yanımda bu mendil olukça bırak Konya'ya...
english: Leave this towel with me and I'll give it to Konya...

text: ...Fizan’a dahi bile gitsem seni asla unutmam.
english: ...even if I go to physics, I will never forget you.

text: ...sizin gibi bir beyi kalemde ağırlamaktan şeref duyacağım.
english: ...I'd be honored to welcome a gentleman like you in a pencil.

text: ...sakın ola ki abine verdiğim sözü unuttuğumu sanmayasın.
english: ...so you don't think I forgot my promise to your brother.
I said I'll root you, I'll root you.

text: Yakında bütün kayılar önümde diz çökecek.
english: Soon all the rocks will kneel before me.

text: Rüyanda görsen bile hayra yorma soysuz.
english: Even if you dream of it, you're not a good son.

text: Bugün yeniden doğduğun gündür Tekfur Vasilius.
english: Today is the day you were born again, Tekafur Vasilius.
I'm glad you said you were coming.
We've got a table for you.

text: Bu güzel günümüzde yanımızda olmanıza da çok sevindik.
english: We're so glad you're here on this beautiful day.

text: Dün Emir Sadeddin'den bacıma bir mektup geldi Ertuğrul Bey'im.
english: Yesterday, a letter came to my sister from Emir Sadeddin, my lord Ertuğrul.

text: Bacımı düğün hazırlıkları için Ilgın'da bulunan anasının yanına çağırır.
english: He's inviting my sister to his mother's house in Ilgin for wedding preparations.
We're just a woman wondering what her bride is.

text: Yarın kısmetse yola düşmeden evvel sizleri görmek istedim.
english: I wanted to see you guys before I left tomorrow.
I hope we can see your crew.
My brother, who is trapped in corruption...
I lost it when I was growing up.

text: Benim için yaşayan bir cesetten farksızdır.
english: It's no different for me than a living body.
Of course he'll get in trouble.

text: Lakin Rabbim bana yiğit bir abi verdi.
english: But my Lord has given me a strong brother.
My mother took it from me prematurely.

text: Hayme Ana'm gibi görklü bir ana bağışladı bana.
english: He has given me a mother of glory like my mother.
I didn't know what a sister was.

text: Bana en hayırlısını, Halime Sultan'ı nasip etti.
english: He has given me the best, Halime Sultan.

text: Abimin de, benim de, obamızın da şerefini kurtardınız.
english: You saved my brother's honor, mine, and our village.

text: Bilesiniz ki sizi her daim şükranla yad edeceğim.
english: I will always remember you with gratitude.

text: İnşallah bu belalar biter de sizi düğünümde görmek nasip olur.
english: I hope this trouble is over and I'll see you at my wedding.
May God forgive those who love you, my daughter.

text: İnşallah bir ömür boyu mutlu olursun.
english: I hope you're happy for the rest of your life.

text: Saadeti için de devletime hayırlı evlatlar yetiştiresin.
english: And raise up good children for my kingdom.
- I'm going to be a little late.
...and don't let me testify before I go to Obama.
God, let me get to my head.

text: Bu kemer en çok senin ince beline yaraşacak Aslıhan Hatun.
english: This belt will fit your fine waistline best, Aslihan Hatun.
She's not more valuable than my brother.

text: Sadece sizleri bir daha göremeyeceğimi düşündükçe...
english: Just when I thought I'd never see you again...

text: Bunları söylemek bir geline hiç yakışmıyor.
english: It's not appropriate for a bride to say that.

text: Kaldı ki obamız senin de obandır.

english: ...you'll be my joy as my son came.

text: Sil bakalım o güzel gözlerindeki yaşları.
english: Let's wipe those beautiful tears out of your eyes.

text: Sen de yuvanda hoş olasın inşallah.
english: I hope you're welcome at home.
I'm not gonna keep my eye out for you, Mama.
My brother Aliyar, I pray to God first...

text: ...sonra Ertuğrul Bey'ime ve sizlere emanet ederim.
english: ...and then I entrust it to my lord Ertuğrul and you.

text: Altını görünce keyfin yerine geldi usta.
english: You're happy to see the gold, master.

text: İmparator basmış içine gümüşü, basmış içine gümüşü.
english: The Emperor printed silver in it, printed silver in it.

text: Hele bizim maden bir çalışmaya başlasın, sen o zaman gör altını.
english: Well, if we start working on a mine, you see the gold.
Save us from selling our possessions to demons.
...it is a liberation for the Turk.

text: Gerçi hangi Türk için kurtuluş değil ki?
english: But what Turk is not saved?
(Vasilius) Because he came to the pen...
...the brother of that traitor Turk who killed my commanders!
I'll send him to our emperor.

text: Göndereceğim ki senelerdir topraklarımızı işgal eden...
english: I will send those who have occupied our land for years...

text: ...her türlü hainlikle, her türlü tuzakla bizden ekmeğimizi çalan...
english: ...who steals our bread from us with every treachery and every snare...

text: ...o Türklerden imparatorumuz da eliyle intikam alsın.
english: ...and our emperor will take revenge on those Turks.
Keep your eyes open, Crusader Master.

text: Beyim gayrı bu kalede taş üstünde taş koymayacaktır.
english: My lord will not put a stone on a stone in this castle.

text: ...bu kaleyi başlarına yıkmaya geldiğimiz zaman bize yol gösteresin.
english: ...when we come to destroy this castle, lead us.

text: Sen hiç merak etme Dumrul Alp.
english: Don't worry about it, Dumrul Alp.
Send a briefing to my lord Ertuğrul.
Take him to Nikea, our emperor.

text: Maalesef kalemde senin misafirliğin biraz kısa sürdü.
english: Unfortunately, your hospitality in the pen was short-lived.
But you don't have an easy death.

text: Siz Türkler ne diyordunuz? Çok güzel bir laf var.

english: You're on your way to the Sultan.
But you're going to our emperor.

text: Abim sana bu toprakları yâr etmeyecek.
english: My brother won't give you this land.

text: Gayrı vatanımız olacak bu toprakların altında çürüyeceksin.
english: You will rot under this land that will be our unholy homeland.

text: Biraz da tuz koymamız lazım şöyle.
english: We'll have to put some salt in it.

Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey!
He's gonna be like his dad.

text: Gündüz'e bir küheylan yaraşır Ertuğrul Bey.
english: A coward is worthy of the sunrise, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Baba, ben senin gibi binince at neden havaya kalkmaz?
english: Dad, why doesn't a horse get up when I ride like you?
My day lord, my day lord...

text: Ee, atı şaha kaldırmak istersen, evvela büyüyesin.
english: Well, if you want to raise a horse, you gotta grow up first.

text: At sahibine göre iş görür Gündüz'üm.
english: The horse owner's business is daylight.

text: Hele sen bir ayaklan, o da ayaklansın.
english: You're a rebel, and he's a rebel.

text: Daha evladını göreceksin. Yurt tuttuğunuzu göreceksin.
english: You'll see your son, you'll see you're homeless.

text: Doğan, kim yaptı sana bunu kardeşim söyle!
english: Doğan, tell you who did this, brother!

text: Vasilius'la Ural, Dündar Bey'imi götürdü beyim.
english: Vasilius and Ural have taken my Lord Dunder, sir.
I couldn't protect my Mr. Dunbar.

text: -(Bamsı) Beyim, beyim, bir şey yap. -(Ertuğrul) Doğan'ım.
english: - Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey!

text: (Hayme) Bu kalabalık hayra alamet değildir kızım.
english: (Laughter) This crowd is not a good sign, girl.
(Left) Sir, the Dog is leaving, sir!

text: Doğan, aç gözünü. Ne ettiler sana?
english: Do not look at me like that.
- Hey, son. - Hey, baby, what's the big deal?
...to raise him worthy of our father.
(Bani Flower) Don't say that, I'm born with it.
Don't leave me, just stay with me.
(Bani Flower) Born, do not leave me.

text: ...ve eşhedü enne Muhammeden abdûhü ve resûlü.
english: And the ass of Muhammad, the abductor and the messenger.
(Bani Flower) Don't do that, no, no, don't go!

- Baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, you are born, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, you are born, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, you are born, baby, baby, baby, you are born and you are born to be born, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, baby, you are born to be born and you are born to be born
- He's not dead, he's not dead!

text: -(Banı Çiçek) Ölme, ölme Doğan! -(Hayme) Ölmedi kuzum, ölmedi!
english: Don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, don't die, and you are not going to die, you are not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not going to die, not to die, not to die, not to die, not to die, not to die, not to die!
Do not leave us, my nature!

text: Ben Doğan sensiz ne ederim! Doğan, aç gözünü!
english: What would I do without you, Nagan?
(Bani Flower) My man, open your eyes!

text: -(Ertuğrul) Yüklenin! Yüklenin! -(Banı Çiçek) Ne olur beyim, almayın!
english: - What's the matter, sir, don't take it!
Don't take it, don't take it, whatever!
(Bani Flower) Why don't you take it!
We're not in range yet, brother.
We're not in range yet, Daggan.
(Sighs) We're not in time yet, brother.
(Bomb) The birth is not dead brother!
- Let it go, brother, let it go!
My son, my son is gone!
- I'm not going to give it to the ground!
I'm not giving you the Daggan!
- Come on, get on with it!
My son, open your eyes, Nagan!
Don't leave me, my lion, Doğan!

text: (Banı Çiçek) Doğan'ım, uyan, beni yalnız koyma Doğan!
english: My birth, wake up, and leave me not alone, my birth!
We're going to have a baby, Daggan.
(Bani Flower) The victim's case is a coincidence.
(Bani Flower) My birth, open your eyes.

text: (Banı Çiçek) Aslanım uyan. Doğan, Doğan uyan.
(Banı Çiçek) Kurbanın olayım Doğan, Doğan, gitme Doğan.
english: (Bani Flower) The victim's case is Doğan, Doğan, do not go Doğan.
Ertuğrul, what happened to my children?

text: Nihayet Ertuğrul'dan çok değerli bir şey aldın Vasilius.
english: You finally got something more valuable from Ertuğrul, Vasilius.
We'll take it together, Vasilius, together.

text: Aliyar ölüp obanın başına geçtikten sonra...
english: After Aliyar died and passed over the house...
...we'll have nothing left to do together.
You're gonna take your room and go.

text: Her vakit yanında dost bir Türk görmek istemez misin Vasilius?
english: Don't you want to see a friendly Turk with you all the time, Vasilius?
I'm glad you're not in my shoes.
Don't show up when I'm done with you.
Aren't you going to invite me to your wedding?
Helena is so happy to see us.

text: Ne de olsa Türkleri çok seviyor.
Yakında bu topraklarda yaşayacak Türk kalmayacak Ural.
english: Soon there will be no more Turks living in these lands.
You've got your horse wrong, Vasilius.

text: Av yeni başlıyor. Şimdi tuzak kurma vakti.
english: The hunt is just beginning, now it's time to set traps.

text: Bir vakit nasıl da kaçmıştın bu okun ucundan.
english: How you once escaped from this arrowhead.
I couldn't have escaped without my Lord Ertuğrul.
Run, if you want to live!
No one can touch you when I'm with you.
What a day I've been through.

text: Şimdi de geldin Ertuğrul Bey'in yamacında yaşar gidersin.
english: Now you're here to live on the slopes of Mr. Ertuğrul.
I owe a lot to my lord Ertuğrul.
Easy to come by, Master Crusader.
I got something to get you.
How could you let them scratch her?
They took my man from me.
(Flowers) How did they cut you, Daggan?
You're going to be a dummy.
Yesterday, Mr. Sir, I was in the fort.
You're going to send him to Nikea today...

text: ...imparatora savaş hediyesi olarak vereceğini söyledi ahaliye.
english: ...he said he would give the empress as a war gift to the family.
They're going to go down the Red Hill Road, sir.
He's not gonna take another brother from me.

text: Tez kaleye var. Helena'ya haber et.
english: Tell Helena that she's in the castle.
And the Ahan is the bear of these mountains...
...unless I take revenge on those who did this to you...

text: İki evladımı ardımda bırakıp geldim bu topraklara.
english: I came to this land, leaving my two children behind.

text: Bak, bir tanesi orada cansız yatıyor.
english: Look, one of them is lying there lifeless.
I can't take any more pain.
I'll bring him to you, Mom.
...and the guarded men are with you, sir.

text: Herkes şahadet şerbetini içmeye hazır olsun.
english: Everyone be ready to drink the wine of testimony.
He won't return until revenge is taken.
(Halime) Mom, don't let the victim get away with it.
(all of a sudden) Hail to you, sir.

text: -(Hep bir ağızdan) Haydır Allah! -(Hep bir ağızdan) Haktır Allah!
english: By Allah, the Truth, the Truth.
You got rid of me once.
But you're not gonna get away with it again.
Lord Ertuğrul will not save you.

text: Peki, seni Ertuğrul Bey'imin elinden kim kurtaracak?
english: So who will save you from the hand of my lord Ertuğrul?

text: Sen de düşmanının kalesinde sığıntı gibi yaşarsın!
english: And you will live as a refuge in the fortress of your enemy!

text: Sahibin de senin gibi titreyecek ölecek usta.
english: Your master will tremble like you.

text: (Vasilius dış ses) Hazır ol Ertuğrul Bey.
english: (Vasilius outside voice) Get ready, Mr. Ertuğrul.
(Vasilius outside voice) The war has just begun.
